definition: to show off/to make a display of
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with

sentences.english: He is an eminent scholar, but he always keeps his knowledge in the background.
sentences.chinese: 他是位傑出的學者，但他從來不賣弄自己的學問。

sentences.english: We don't want him back on the court because no one likes a show-off.
sentences.chinese: 我們不想讓他重返球場，因爲沒人喜歡賣弄。

sentences.english: Her head, a marvel, was the object of the most coquettish care.
sentences.chinese: 她的頭是一個奇蹟，是最能賣弄風情的體。

sentences.english: Pedantry is the unseasonable ostentation of learning.
sentences.chinese: “炫學者”，不合季節賣弄學問的人。

sentences.english: An ex is flirting, do not entertain them please.
sentences.chinese: 你的前任開始賣弄風情，千萬別取悅他們。

sentences.english: You can't be to flirty, mama, and know how to undress me.
sentences.chinese: 不要賣弄風情，女人，你知道如何讓我赤裸相向。

sentences.english: To spend or expend intemperately or wastefully; squander.
sentences.chinese: 浪費賣弄地娛樂消費的人。
你是一個愛賣弄風騷的人嗎？

sentences.english: He likes girls that play the coquette.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡賣弄風情的女子。

sentences.english: Resist the urge to show off your technical skills.
sentences.chinese: 請忍住賣弄自己的技術技能的衝動。

sentences.english: She coquetted with every young man she met.
sentences.chinese: 她向她碰到的每個年輕男人都賣弄風騷。

sentences.english: Those who publicly overstep the mark by their ostentation .
sentences.chinese: 那些到處賣弄公然逾越社交規範的人。

sentences.english: Those boys always show off their sports skills to the girls.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩們老向女孩賣弄他們的運動技巧。

sentences.english: Of course she'll flirt with anybody .
sentences.chinese: 當然，她對誰都賣弄風情。

sentences.english: He did not like the way Fumin showed off his knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 他不喜歡富民賣弄知識的作法。

sentences.english: The beauty queen showboat around the stage at the end of the show.
sentences.chinese: 選美皇后們在選美會結束前繞舞臺一圈賣弄一番。

definition: to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
